body.description: The Klipsch Synergy Black Label B-100 Bookshelf Speakers can be used as front-facing or surround speakers as part of a larger home theater set-up. Outfitted with Klipsch proprietary horn technology, single 4” high-output woofer, and a dynamic .75” Tweeter, the B-100 speakers sound just as loud and crisp as floor standing speakers.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: PERFECT HARMONY The Klipsch Synergy Black Label Series is an amazing value in high-performance entertainment.
EASY INTEGRATION Not only does the Synergy Series offer high-efficiency, world-class sound, the components’ sleek black ash vinyl finish complements any home decor.

LEGENDARY TECH FOR AN EPIC SOUND Synergy Black Label floorstanding speakers, bookshelf speakers, and center channel speakers feature Klipsch proprietary Tractrix horn technology, which provides a uniform, 90 x 90 dispersion pattern and allows for placement just about anywhere.

HEAR EVERY NOTE Synergy Black Label speakers are designed to give you an amazing sound stage with the latest technology inside these sleek speaker components: ALUMINUM DIAPHRAGM COMPRESSION DRIVER (TWEETER): Produces crystal-clear high frequenciesLINEAR TRAVEL SUSPENSION: Minimizes distortionIMG WOOFERS: Create tight musical bass

F-300 Floorstanding Speaker The ultimate in Synergy Series performance, the F-300 is an amazing-sounding tower speaker at an affordable price. LEARN MORE F-200 Floorstanding Speaker A true representation of sound and style, the F-200 is the epitome of Synergy performance at a great price. LEARN MORE B-200 Bookshelf Speakers The Klipsch Synergy Black Label B-200 Bookshelf speakers feature our proprietary Tractrix Horn technology which produces a unique combination of precision and effortless power. LEARN MORE B-100 Bookshelf Speakers The Synergy Black Label B-100 bookshelf speakers will shake your space, no matter the size. LEARN MORE C-200 Center Channel Speaker Whether it’s a whisper, sigh or a scream of terror, the C-200 Center Channel speaker ensures every bit of dialogue is captured with precision for the ultimate listening experience. LEARN MORE

SUB-120 Subwoofer Powerful bass and legendary Klipsch acoustics combine to create the Synergy Black Label Sub-120 subwoofer. LEARN MORE SUB-100 Subwoofer The Synergy Black Label Sub 100 features an updated grille and the legendary sound you've come to expect from Klipsch. LEARN MORE

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pair with Fosi Audio v3 for awesome PC speaker system!
reviews.reviewText: I was looking around for a good quality audio solution for Mac Studio, and I was thinking about buying some PC speakers such as the Logitech Z407, or the Bose Companion 2.The thing I liked about the Z407 was that it had an a night knob controller you could position anywhere to control them. What I didn't like was the need for a sub, nor did I care for the fact the speakers would go into sleep mode, and it would take a moment for them to detect an audio signal, making so you missed audio pieces.What I liked about the Bose was really the fact they were a pretty compact design, but over all, Bose sound quality is pretty lack luster, and I didn't like the fact the controls were physically on the speaker, which I wanted to locate outside of easy reach.Thats where using a small class D amp, like the Fosi v3, provides the ability to have the audio controls where you want them, speakers where you want them, and the audio never goes to sleep on you. Then of course, you have the freedom of picking your speakers of choice. I picked these Klipsch B-100 speakers, mostly because they were the smallest set of bookshelf speakers by a name brand I recognized. I must admit, I'm SERIOUS impressed with the entire setup. The Fosi v3 is a straight up audiophile level amp, and these B-100 speakers have completely exceeded my expectations! I don't think I've ever heard speakers this small sound this good. I have two other multi-thousand dollar sound systems, and I can't say this competes with those, but it gets far closer to their quality than I would have imagined possible, especially at this size!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great speakers for the money
reviews.reviewText: No, they're not "audiophile" speakers, but they're great for the price. I'm using these as front speakers for my home theater, and the power and the frequency range are perfect for the job. Also, the sound is really clean when playing John Williams scores, which are good sound tests since orchestrals hit basically all the types of sound you'll come across during movies (not counting bass, which is handled by the subwoofer).Their physical size makes them work nicely with a clean and minimalist room design.I've wall-mounted these with an inch between the wall and the speakers, and technically you're not *supposed* to do that because they're rear ported (manual calls for a solid two feet of space between the walls and the speakers). However, there really doesn't seem to be any unwanted bass amplification or muddied sound, so I seem to be fine. It's possible that setting the crossover to 80hz in order to send the lower frequencies to the subwoofer may have helped in this.If I upgrade I'll be going for front-ported speakers speakers that are designed to be wall mounted, but that's a lot more $$$ for another time. At $75/speaker this is really solid performance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I expected from Klipsch
reviews.reviewText: My first pair of Klipsch speakers. Been using Polk speakers for years. I sold off most of my stereo gear when we downsized a couple of years ago. Picking back up lately wanted to try Klipsch. This is the smallest speaker they make and they fit my TV table perfectly. I wasn’t expecting booming bass from 4” drivers. But the bass is still good. The real benefit is the mid range and highs. Very clear sound. I value quality over quantity. Paired with a 50 watt per channel amp they are very close to perfect!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Can't beat the price!
reviews.reviewText: A great value! These are not some cheap plastic pair of computer speakers. They have surprising bass for their size and actually image. Also can be driven to acceptable levels with a small amplifier (20 to 30 watts RMS). Don't expect room shaking bass, but there is enough there to be quite satisfying. Oh, and you can't beat the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Sound quality is amazing, as I've grown to expect from a brand like Klipsch. Huge sound from such small bookshelf speakers! Add a subwoofer and rock the house.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These small but powerful speakers are absolutely amazing. I have always loved listening to my vinyl but after buying these, I’m finding myself listening to them even more every day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big Improvement over Bose
reviews.reviewText: I bought two pairs of these to replace my front and back Bose bookshelf speakers (fronts were different model than rears before) in my 5.1 system. These were quite a bit smaller so I worried they would lack proper bass response, especially since I mostly use my 5.1 system for music, but my fears were unfounded. These speakers have great full-spectrum frequency response and have never started 'flapping out' or distorting, even at pretty extreme volume levels (far louder than I would ever normally listen to). I can't say I've noticed a whole lot of difference with films though they are definitely noticeably clearer than the bose speakers they replaced. I would say if your prime use of a 5.1, or even stereo system is films and television, these might be overkill, but for my purposes they are terrific given the price (black Friday discount they still aren't prohibitively expensive).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Made surround sound complete
reviews.reviewText: They work well with the rest of K speakers. Quick delivery, great packaging.

it's perfect for a small room rear speaker ,good sound for a small speaker. over priced in Canada at $299. only $129 in US.(where they were shipped from). could have gotten larger ones cheaper but had limited space.
Excelente bocinas para sorroundSonido muy claroY precio excelenteRecomendable

reviews.reviewTitle: Great show from a small speaker.Klipsch delivers!

reviews.reviewText: Y la verdad me convenció su sonido, a pesar de su tamaño. En las películas, las voces y diálogos son claros, las explosiones se alcanzan a disfrutar (no uso subwoofer); cumple con lo que queria: un par de bocinas económicas, discretas y pequeñas.Lo único que no me gusta es que los pines que sostienen la malla protectora no se ubican en esta, sino en la cara de la bocina, se ve muy feo desde mi punto de vista, por lo que decidí usarlas siempre con la malla puesta. Las recomiendo.
Great speakers. Poor experience. I waited 20 days only to be told there is no stock.
